get.description: Basic information about the API, including the operating environment and the current git commit.
Redirects to the current git commit on GitHub.
get.summary: Redirect to the current git commit on GitHub

get.description: Show Swagger API documentation, generated from annotations in the running code.

post.description: Echo the request back to the client, including the provided Token and associated User.
post.summary: Echo the request back to the client

get.description: Delete the OAuth Bearer Token provided in the Authorization header (e.g. to log out).
Echo a parsed User-Agent header.
Get a paginated list of device counts by date.
Get the number of devices encountered on the specified date.

put.description: Update the number of devices encountered on the specified date.

head.description: Check if the specified Device Count exists.

get.description: Get a list of dates for which devices exist.
Get a list of User IDs for which devices exist.
List Devices, paging with reverse, limit, and offset. Optionally, filter by UserID or Date.

post.description: Create a new Device from a User-Agent header.

get.description: Get Device by ID.

put.description: Update the specified Device from a User-Agent header.

delete.description: Delete and return the specified Device.

head.description: Check if the specified Device exists.

get.description: Get Device Versions by ID, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.
Get Device Version by ID and VersionID.

head.description: Check if the specified Device version exists.

get.description: Get a list of email addresses for which emails exist.
Get a list of status codes for which emails exist.

List Emails, paging with reverse, limit, and offset. Optionally, filter by email address or status.
Regular users can only list their own Emails. Administrators can list all Emails.

post.description: Create and send a new Email message.

Location.description: URL of the newly created Email

get.description: Get Email by ID.

put.description: Update the provided complete Email. If the status is PENDING, the Email is sent.

delete.description: Delete and return the specified Email.

head.description: Check if the specified Email exists.

get.description: Get Email Versions by ID, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.
Get Email Version by ID and VersionID.

head.description: Check if the specified Email version exists.

get.description: Get a paginated list of ISO dates (e.g. yyyy-mm-dd) for which events exist.
Get a paginated list of entity IDs for which events exist.
Get a complete, sorted list of entity types for which events exist.
Get a complete, sorted list of log levels for which events exist.

List Events, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.
Optionally, filter by date, entity ID, or log level.
If no filter is specified, the default is to return up to limit recent Events in reverse order.

Location.description: URL of the newly created Event

get.description: Get Event by ID.

delete.description: Delete and return the specified Event.

head.description: Check if the specified Event exists.

get.description: Get a list of status codes for which organizations exist.
List Organizations, paging with reverse, limit, and offset. Optionally, filter by status.

Location.description: URL of the newly created Organization

get.description: Get Organization by ID.

delete.description: Delete and return the specified Organization.

head.description: Check if the specified Organization exists.

get.description: Get Organization Versions by ID, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.
Get Organization Version by ID and VersionID.

head.description: Check if the specified Organization version exists.

get.description: List User IDs for which tokens exist. This is useful for paging through tokens by user.
get.summary: List User IDs for which tokens exist

get.description: List OAuth Bearer Tokens by User ID (defaults to the Context User).

parameters.description: User ID or Email (defaults to the Context User)
parameters.name: user

400.description: Bad Request (invalid User ID or Email)

403.description: Forbidden (only administrators may read any user's tokens)

post.description: Create a new OAuth Bearer Token.

Location.description: URL of the newly created Token

get.description: Read OAuth Bearer Token by ID (e.g. to verify a token has not expired).

403.description: Forbidden (only administrators may read any user's tokens)

delete.description: Delete OAuth Bearer Token by ID (e.g. to log out).

403.description: Forbidden (only administrators may delete any user's tokens)

head.description: Check if the specified OAuth Bearer Token exists.

get.description: Generate the specified number of TUIDs, based on the current system time.
get.summary: Generate the specified number of TUIDs

post.description: Generate a new TUID based on current system time and return the TUIDInfo.

Location.description: URL of the newly created TUID

get.description: Parse the provided TUID, returning the TUIDInfo. This can be useful for extracting the timestamp from an ID.
get.summary: Read TUIDInfo for the provided TUID

get.description: Get a paginated list of email addresses for which users exist.
Get a list of Organization IDs for which users exist.
Get a list of roles for which users exist.
Get a list of status codes for which users exist.

List Users, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.
Optionally, filter by email, organization, role, or status.

Location.description: URL of the newly created User

get.description: Get User by ID or email, scrubbing sensitive information if the requester is not an administrator.

403.description: Forbidden (only administrators may read any user)

put.description: Update the provided complete User, ensuring that sensitive information is retained.

delete.description: Delete and return the specified User. Attempt to delete their associated Tokens as well, logging errors.

head.description: Check if the specified User exists.

get.description: Get User Versions by User ID, paging with reverse, limit, and offset.
Get User Version by ID and VersionID, scrubbing sensitive information if the requester is not an administrator.

head.description: Check if the specified User version exists.

get.description: Get a paginated list of view counts by date.
Get the number of views encountered on the specified date.

put.description: Update the number of views encountered on the specified date.

head.description: Check if the specified View Count exists.

get.description: Get a list of dates for which views exist.
Get a list of Device IDs for which views exist.
List Views, paging with reverse, limit, and offset. Optionally, filter by DeviceID or Date.

post.description: Create a new View with an associated new/updated Device.

get.description: Get View by ID.

delete.description: Delete and return the specified View.

head.description: Check if the specified View exists.

clientName.description: ClientName indicates the application name (Chrome, Googlebot, Edge, etc.)

clientType.description: ClientType indicates the application category (App, Bot, Browser, or Other)

clientVersion.description: ClientVersion indicates the extractVersion of the application, if provided

deviceType.description: DeviceType indicates the general device category (Desktop, Mobile, Tablet, Other)

fields.description: Fields contains parsed/cleaned segments of the User-Agent request header, used for analysis

header.description: Header is the provided User-Agent request header

osName.description: OSName indicates the operating system running on the device (Android, Linux, iOS, macOS, Windows, etc.)

osVersion.description: OSVersion indicates the operating system version, if available

url.description: URL indicates the URL provided, typically for information about a bot/crawler.

id.description: Page ID (paths change, but IDs do not)
